IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Serving the physical, social, spiritual, educational and cultural interactive needs of its members.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Our mission is to foster an appreciation of Jewish identity, values and culture, to promote health, education and welfare of our members, to strengthen Jewish family life, to build a sense of community and ensure Jewish continuity for our children.
IRS990.Desc: Early Childhood - The program provides an educational setting that offers an education enhanced with swim classes, planned activities in the gymnasium and outdoor recreation areas, computer classes, and hands-on science classes in an interactive nature and science room.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Summer Camp - Camp by the Sea provides a high quality summer camp experience for children from two years old through tenth grade. With the partnership of specially trained staff, the camp also offers inclusive accomodations for children with a variety of physical, intellectual, emotional and developmental needs.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Race Series - Includes the Atlantic City Marathon, the April Fool's Run and the Beach Bungalow Race and provides events that allow participants of all skill levels to participate and accomplish their personal goals in addittion to providing sponsors and the local community highly effective exposure throughout the year to help maximize their presence and support of the community.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: All other program services including aquatics, fitness, health club, sports and recreation, youth and teen, adult and senior programs.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Management has evaluated uncertain tax positions taken by the Organization. The financial statement effects of a tax position are recognized when the position is more likely than not, based on the technical merits, to be sustained upon examination by the Internal Revenue Service or other taxing authority. The Organization has recognized no interest or penalties related to uncertain tax positions. The Organization is subject to routine audits by taxing jurisdictions; however, there are currently no audits for any tax periods in progress. Management believes it is no longer subject to income tax examinations for years prior to 2020.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The completed Form 990 is reviewed and approved by the organization's governing body prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All Officers and Board Members sign an acknowledgement stating that they have read, understand and accept the provisions of the code of ethics and responsibility. This code includes that they will avoid, refrain and refuse any actions that could give the appearance of an impropriety or conflict of interest. Any disclosures would be reviewed by the Executive Director along with the Executive Committee or entire Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Annually, the Executive Director is evaluated and performance is reviewed by the Executive Committee. Compensation is determined by performance results and comparison to the National Industry Association's National Salary Survey for a similar sized agency. The key employees are evaluated by the Executive Director and compensated based on the amounts approved by the Board of Directors through the annual budgeting process. Key employee compensations are also compared to the National Industry Association's National Salary Survey for reasonableness.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All of the organization's governing documents, policies and financial statements are available for the public to inspect at the organization's office, or by mail upon written request. Form 990 is available upon request and can also be obtained via the website www.guidestar.org.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part XII, Line 2c, Audit Oversight:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The process has not changed from the prior year.
